Detailed Description

StreamWriter is a base class for classes implementing a writer to a stream. StreamWriters are accessed from Streams. Subclasses should derived from this base class for the different streams. For example, for a FileStream and corresponding FileStreamWriter should be provided.
See also:
StreamReader

virtual void StreamWriter::RequestWrite (  StreamingWriteInfo &  write_info,
const StreamingCallback *  callback_object = 0
)  [pure virtual]
 

Requests to write the data given in write_info object to the stream.

This is a non-blocking call and the write operation normally is not completed synchroneously. Instead, this stream writer has to respond with a callback CallbackWrite to the given call back object callback_object.

The data to write is given in the write_info object in fields data_to_write and nr_bytes_to_write. As soon as the requested number of bytes are written, this stream writer is intended to responds with a CallbackWrite to the given callback object. However, when the number of bytes cannot be written, the stream writer is intended to respond with an error state.

The result of the operation is stored in write_info, in particular, if the the read operation has been completed synchroneously or not.

See also:
StreamingWriteInfo
Parameters:
write_info [in/out] The object holding all the information about the write operation
callback_object [in] The object receiving the asynchroneous callback for this write operation

virtual void StreamWriter::Seek (  Stream::Origin  origin,
INT32  offset,
StreamingInfo &  info
)  [pure virtual]
 

Shifts the current writing position of this stream writer offset bytes based on the origin, which might be StreamBegin, StreamEnd, StreamCurrent

Parameters:
origin [in] the origin of the seek operation
offset [in] the offset for repositioning relativ to the origin
info [in/out] the info object which will hold information about this operation
